h3.a: The Rankin Difference, Spirit, and Passion Remain Open!

div.p: THE RANKIN DIFFERENCE, SPIRIT, and PASSION REMAIN OPEN!

Dear Families,
Within the last few hours, Governor Pritzker announced that in-person instruction is suspended for the remainder of this academic school year, effectively closing our physical building for the 2019-2020 school year. My heart goes out to our students, staff, and families!

Yesterday, I did come across a news report that indicated that today’s closure announcement appeared imminent, which provided me a little bit of time for reflection. My overwhelming belief is that while our campus is closed for this academic year, the Rankin difference, spirit, and passion remain very much open, alive, and well! Our staff, students, and families will continue to work together to make the absolute best out of this situation. We will not waiver on accomplishing our new mission of engaging and connecting our students daily and supporting everyone! We will continue to brainstorm, collaborate, and innovate!

While you may have questions about the future, please note that various ideas and options about making the best of the situation will be discussed with the Rankin Leadership Team and then our Board of Education at the next meeting on April 27th. I will then update everyone accordingly. We are in this TOGETHER! Enjoy the weekend and then we will “see” you on Monday as we push forward. Please remember that if you are in need, please reach out at mgordon@rankin98.org. Go Rebels!

a.aria-label: Read more about The Rankin Difference, Spirit, and Passion Remain Open!

div.p: The latest COVID-19/Coronavirus updates are provided via email and on our Facebook page.
*The phone numbers for (the 24-hour Rankin COVID-19/Coronavirus Support Line and the 9 a.m. - 1:30 p.m. Rankin Nurse Line) are highlighted in email and on our Facebook page.

span.span: Thank you for visiting our Remote Learning Plan. Please see information below.
*Mission - ENGAGE OUR STUDENTS IN LEARNING, CONNECT OUR STAFF AND STUDENTS, and SUPPORT EVERYONE!
*Email Directory - Our Staff's Email Directory can be found here http://www.rankin98.org/vnews/display.v/SEC/District%7CFaculty/Staff%20Directory
*Meal Delivery Service - If you would like to be put on our weekly meal delivery services, please email Dr. Matt Gordon, Superintendent, at mgordon@rankin98.org.
*Resources - Our District's Symbaloo (master list of online resources) can be accessed here http://www.rankin98.org/vnews/display.v/SEC/Resources%7CDistrict%20Symbaloo
*Grade Levels/Subjects - Please use the tabs above to navigate to your child's grade level and subjects for Remote Learning Plan guidance.
*Daily Schedule - Parents are encouraged to help our students set up a daily routine to engage in learning. Our Teachers and Teacher Aides will be encouraging our students to do this electronically.
9 a.m.-1:30 p.m. E-Learning or E-Learning Packet work (Staff is coordinating schedule for virtual meetings, lessons, and classes).
E-Learning and E-Learning Packet work can take place before and/or after the daily 9 a.m. - 1:30 p.m. time period.
*ELL learners - We would coordinate a plan for students who have this need. Currently, we don’t have any students who have this need.

*Students with Special Needs - Our Special Education Teachers, Teachers, and Teacher’ Aides are reaching out to students with Special Needs individually to engage them in learning while striving to accommodate and plan for their individual needs. In addition, our staff is trying to continue to make progress on students’ IEP goals.

*Monitoring Student Engagement - We are monitoring how our students are engaging and have created a Google Doc to determine if internet help can be provided or if learning packets need to be distributed. This Doc is helping the District monitor which students are engaging on a daily basis.
*Technology - An electronic device to use at home was made available to all students.

*Communication - Students and parents will be updated about the general nature of our plan. Teachers and Teacher’s Aides are utilizing email, Google Classroom, Zoom, and other technology-based platforms to engage students in learning.

*Assessment/Grading/Credit - Retroactively back to March 16th, our staff has the autonomy to provide feedback, grades, credit, and/or assessment to students for any work and/or activities completed during this entire closure period through our future return. The stipulation is that grades, credit, and/or assessment may not negatively impact a student’s academic standing. Thus, our teachers are going to determine the academic standing (i.e. level of progress and/or cumulative grade) as of March 13th, and then ensure that the grades during this closure period do not negatively impact a student's academic standing.

*Plan Revisions/Updates – Our District is learning daily as we implement this plan. We will continue to review and/or revise our plan to address the difficulties and challenges we encounter. For any significant changes, the Rankin Association of Teachers will be consulted.
*Administrative Support - Superintendent and Principal will be assisting staff, students, and parents throughout this process.
*Superintendent Challenges - These are provided via email and Facebook Live on school days during the closure. Also, please join us on Facebook Live at 9:00 a.m. each school day.

*Transition to In-Person Instruction - The Rankin Leadership Team will collaborate and develop strategies for our staff to assist everyone upon return. Strategies to assist this transition process will strive to address assessment, differentiation, review of content, recognizing and identifying students who need additional support, meeting goals for students with disabilities, and how to provide ongoing support for staff. These strategies will be provided to staff and may vary depending on the date of return, subject area, and/or grade level.
*Questions - Please don't hesitate to contact your teachers and/or Dr. Matt Gordon, Superintendent at mgordon@rankin98.org.
KEEP LEARNING!
